summary: This Q&A report discusses federal food purchases for places like schools and military bases. The Agricultural Marketing Service and Defense Logistics Agency are the two largest federal purchasers, awarding billions of dollars in contracts annually to procure food. The agencies are generally required to buy domestic food—but they aren't required to buy locally grown food. Agency documentation suggests that they both attempt to source, or...
title: Federal Food Purchases: Buying from Small Businesses and Local Sources
